metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2324 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in (1) mod_evhost and (2) mod_simple_vhost in lighttpd before 1.4.35 allow remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in the host name, related to request_check_hostname.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.35-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.35-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.35-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-mysql-vhost - 1.4.35-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.35-1ubuntu1
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.35-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.35-1ubuntu1').
